archdesc.runner: Special Collections and Archives, Johnston Memorial Library, Virginia State University

did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.repository: Special Collections and Archives, Johnston Memorial Library, Virginia State University
did.abstract: One item: a letter written by his aunt who was a member of the faculty at Virginia State University. The letter dated December 8, 1922 is full of information about working and some sports activities. Acc. #1991-63

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The Donald Frazier papers, 1991-63, Special Collections and Archives, Johnston Memorial Library, Virginia State University, Petersburg, VA.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Information
bioghist.p: Alvira Hazzard came to the Virginia Normal and Industrial Institute in 1922 as an Instructor of High School Chemistry. Ms. Hazzard was a graduate of The Wooster (Mass.) State Normal School in 1921. She was at Virginia State University for only one year.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Information
scopecontent.p: A fine letter detailing Ms Hazzard's experience at Virginia State. Topics in the letter concern students, workloads, athletic events, and the overall atmosphere of the campus.
